7: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT "Select Bibliography") AS unique_sources FROM roman_cities
2: SELECT ROUND(AVG(CASE WHEN INSTR("Barrington Atlas Rank", ' or ') > 0 THEN (CAST(REPLACE(SUBSTRING("Barrington Atlas Rank", 1, INSTR("Barrington Atlas Rank", ' or ') - 1), ',', '') AS REAL) + CAST(REPLACE(SUBSTRING("Barrington Atlas Rank", INSTR("Barrington Atlas Rank", ' or ') + 4), ',', '') AS REAL)) / 2 ELSE CAST(REPLACE("Barrington Atlas Rank", ',', '') AS REAL) END), 4) AS average_rank FROM "roman_cities" WHERE "Country" = 'Greece'
3: SELECT ROUND(ca, 4) AS calcium_ppm FROM climate_measurements ORDER BY "ODP 967 Dust proxy" ASC, "ODP 967 wet-dry index" ASC LIMIT 1
0: SELECT ROUND(AVG(k), 4) AS average_potassium FROM climate_measurements ORDER BY interval_cm
9: SELECT country, AVG(population) AS avg_population FROM worldcities GROUP BY country ORDER BY avg_population DESC LIMIT 1
10: SELECT rowid FROM climate_measurements WHERE (CASE WHEN NOT "Unnamed: 20" IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) + (CASE WHEN NOT "Unnamed: 24" IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) = 0
5: SELECT city FROM worldcities WHERE lat < 0 AND lng < 0 ORDER BY population DESC LIMIT 1
1: SELECT ROUND(SUM(CASE WHEN "ODP 967 wet-dry index" > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT("Interval_cm") * 100, 2) AS percentage_increasing_wet_dry_index FROM climate_measurements
11: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT t1.conflict) AS numberofconflicts FROM conflict_brecke AS t1 JOIN worldcities AS t2 ON t1.conflict = t2.city WHERE t1.startyear BETWEEN 800 AND 1400 AND t1.endyear - t1.startyear >= 1
4: SELECT ROUND((SELECT MAX("Al") FROM "climate_measurements" WHERE "Depth below seafloor_m" IN (SELECT "Depth below seafloor_m" FROM "climate_measurements" ORDER BY ABS("Depth below seafloor_m" - (SELECT STRFTIME('%Y', "radiocarbon_data"."date") AS year FROM "radiocarbon_data" WHERE "Material" = 'Neolithic' AND "Latitude" = (SELECT MAX("Latitude") FROM "radiocarbon_data" WHERE "Material" = 'Neolithic') ORDER BY "date" DESC LIMIT 1)) LIMIT 1)), 4)
8: SELECT AVG(CASE WHEN "roman_cities"."Barrington Atlas Rank" LIKE '%or%' THEN (CAST(SUBSTRING("roman_cities"."Barrington Atlas Rank", 1, INSTR("roman_cities"."Barrington Atlas Rank", ' or ') - 1) AS REAL) + CAST(SUBSTRING("roman_cities"."Barrington Atlas Rank", INSTR("roman_cities"."Barrington Atlas Rank", ' or ') + 4) AS REAL)) / 2 ELSE CAST("roman_cities"."Barrington Atlas Rank" AS REAL) END) AS correlation FROM "roman_cities" INNER JOIN "worldcities" ON ABS("roman_cities"."Latitude (Y)" - "worldcities"."lat") < 0.1 AND ABS("roman_cities"."Longitude (X)" - "worldcities"."lng") < 0.1 WHERE "worldcities"."population" > 1000000
6: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT modern_city.*, ancient_roman_city.*, (6371 * ACOS(COS(RADIANS(modern_city.lat)) * COS(RADIANS(ancient_roman_city."Latitude (Y)")) * COS(RADIANS(modern_city.lng) - RADIANS(ancient_roman_city."Longitude (X)")) + SIN(RADIANS(modern_city.lat)) * SIN(RADIANS(ancient_roman_city."Latitude (Y)")))) AS distance FROM worldcities AS modern_city INNER JOIN roman_cities AS ancient_roman_city ON 1 = 1 WHERE modern_city.population > 100000) WHERE distance <= 0.1
